column4: How can I test whether or not the wlan is working? Shouldn't all wireless accesspoints be listed, even if they are secured in some way?
sudo iwlist scan
wil show all APs in range
there is no GUI application? Thanks
its a standard way to test for now, there are gui apps, but use this for now
I get interface does not support scanning.
then its not setup right
I have an ar242x
I didn really set it up yet, nor do I know how I should do it.
whatÅ› the easiest way to enable it?
you need to run lspci and it will show you what it is. You can websearch from there
I already told you which one it is.
according to System -> Administration -> Hardware drivers the Atheros driver is enabled. What else do I need to do?
try typing hello really fast
or any search engine at all
yes, you are right. I do not know a better search engine than google, though.
there is no better, they are all equal
different search algorithms different results
search is a part of information retrieval. For some queries you can measure which one is better.
depends on the search criteria. Ive found ask.com to yield more accurately than google in many cases
but I agree that searching for Britney Spears could return either the official webpage first and then the wikipedia entry or in the other order.
ok, I will test ask.com with some of my test queries.
which is why i say "websearch" rather than "google"
all i'm saying is that there is more than goole
ask.com has a smaller index, but for the queries I entered that did have a result, the result was good enough.
theres also msn.com and yahoo.com too, all are equally good
msn.com is not very good, imho. Yahoo is quite good, indeed, but slightly slower I think.
true, it is slower
true but it isnt the one and only
and sometimes it throws up some real garbage
uninstall gnash + swfdec + adobe flash then close firefox, then reinstall only adobe flash
does this mean it is a known problem?
because I am pretty sure I don't have gnash.
and I also don't have swfdec
no, you just need to remove all flashes then reinstall the single plugin
I only have one plugin installed.
and I reinstalled it a month ago or so already.
then run: dpkg -l | grep flash
sudo apt-get --purge remove flashplugin-installer flashplugin-nonfree; sudo apt-get --purge autoremove
can you also run: dpkg -l | grep gnash; dpkg -l | grep swf
returns nothing
ok thats good
ok now run: sudo apt-get clean; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree
sudo fdisk -l
is flash better now?
I meant make and model. 2) Didn't check yet.
sudo lshw -C disk | less
hdparm -i /dev/sda
oh, I didn't see your response yet, but this worked at least.
mine shows for all disks, even cd drives ;)
it appears that Flash is working now. Probably they fixed it in the last version?
i'm going with a combo of having the 2 packages install and the fact that flash sucks
I agree that Flash sucks. Corporations want control; Flash gives them the illusion of this control.
thing is it could be a billion times better if it was open
The Flash specification is open.
everything could be better with people cooperating, but that's not how the world is run today.
the existence of Linux is a miracle to begin with.
true, bit offtopic here though ;)
in google type:  java natty     and hit'i'm feeling lucky'
it is a bug, imho, that the software center doesn't find it.
it's in the partner repo
I just use that PPA as it gets updated more frequently
how do I know that is not a trojan?
technically you  don't but 99.999999% of PPAs are fine
I don't need the latest and greatest. What is the latest in the partner repo for 11.04?
not sure, enable the partner repo and see, or just use that ppa. Your call
ok, thanks.
what is the output of:  tail -n 1 /etc/update-manager/release-upgrades
Prompt=normal
ad who is this "you" you are referencing?
'you' = whoever implemented this non working system.
run:   sudo apt-get install update-manager-core; sudo do-release-upgrade
pastebin the result if there are any issues
is it running?
not yet
np
I only don't really get why it bothers me with so many questions.
its if you added any 3rd party sources and such
like 'some sources have been disabled, press ENTER to continue'.
quite normal
and it doesn't work.
can you pastebin the output please
http://paste.debian.net/149589/
ok can you pastebin the output of:   sudo apt-get upate; sudo apt-get upgrade
why do you have the proposed repo enabled?
do you mean the held back packages?
the whole output of the command I gave please
do you want me to run the command too?
it needs to download about 1GB.\
those are the updates, it may square off the system and make things better
you can create an Oneiric install media, part of the CD is to upgrade an established install
http://paste.debian.net/149592/
wow, you have a lot of packages, have you ever upgraded the install?
I have +-4500 packages installed.
yes, I have.
although, why would I want to update every single day>
I have better things to do.
also, all this system administration is not what I want to do.
